intro: Phlomoides tibetica var. wardii, commonly known as the Tibetan phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, hairy leaves, and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the cold, arid conditions of its mountainous habitat. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
